item.title: Aligning Priesthood Keys: One Work of Salvation
item.description: A priesthood training session related to the greater work of salvation including missionary work, temple service and family history.

category.title: Teacher Training - Gospel Teaching and Learning Handbook Video Resources
category.subtitle: Videos: 2

item.title: An Introduction to the New Teaching and Learning Handbook
item.description: Brother Webb gives an introduction on the new Teaching and Learning Handbook and gives some instruction on its use.

item.title: An Introduction to the New Teaching and Learning Handbook
item.description: Brother Webb gives an introduction on the new Teaching and Learning Handbook and gives some instruction on its use.

item.title: Welfare Overview
item.description: This video gives you an overview of the Welfare program and how it helps those in need all over the world.

item.title: Becoming the Person You Were Born to Be
Becoming True Millennials Highlight 1
item.description: Ask your Heavenly Father, in the name of Jesus Christ, how He feels about you and your mission here on earth. If you ask with real intent, over time the Spirit will whisper life-changing truths to you.

item.title: Becoming True Millennials Highlight 2
item.description: How will you accomplish the impossible? By doing whatever it takes to strengthen your faith in Jesus Christ by increasing your understanding of the doctrine taught in His restored Church and by relentlessly seeking truth

item.title: Becoming True Millennials Highlight 3
item.description: Our Heavenly Father and His Son stand ready to respond to your questions through the ministering of the Holy Ghost. But it is up to you to learn how to qualify for, and receive, those answers.

item.title: Becoming True Millennials Highlight 4
item.description: My dear young friends, you can know the mind and will of the Lord for your own life. You do not have to wonder if you are where the Lord needs you to be or if you are doing what He needs you to do. You can know! The Holy Ghost will tell you

item.title: Becoming True Millennials Highlight 5
item.description: You may not always understand every declaration of a living prophet. But when you know a prophet is a prophet, you can approach the Lord in humility and faith and ask for your own witness about whatever His prophet has proclaimed.

item.title: Like A Watered Garden
item.description: September 13, 2015: Elder L. Whitney Clayton urges us to seek the abundant life Christ offers all who are rooted in Him.

item.title: Tasting the Light
item.description: May 3, 2015: Elder Lynn G. Robbins shows how to discover the strength of your testimony, and gives counsel on how to make its growth continual.

item.title: Living with Purpose: The Importance of “Real Intent”
item.description: January 11, 2015: Brother Randall L. Ridd challenges us to start living a purposeful life now by putting the power of the compounding of daily disciplines in place in the important areas of our lives.

item.title: Tasting the Light - Highlight 1
item.description: May 3, 2015: An Evening with Elder Lynn G. Robbins, Highlight.

item.title: Tasting the Light - Highlight 2
item.description: May 3, 2015: An Evening with Elder Lynn G. Robbins, Highlight.

item.title: Tasting the Light - Highlight 3
item.description: May 3, 2015: An Evening with Elder Lynn G. Robbins, Highlight.

item.title: An Invitation and Promise
item.description: Invitation and promise from the May 3, 2015 Worldwide Devotional broadcast.

item.title: Living with Purpose: The Importance of “Real Intent” - Highlight 1
item.description: January 11, 2015: An Evening with Brother Randall L. Ridd, Highlight.

item.title: Living with Purpose: The Importance of “Real Intent” - Highlight 2
item.description: January 11, 2015: An Evening with Brother Randall L. Ridd, Highlight.

item.title: Living with Purpose: The Importance of “Real Intent” - Highlight 3
item.description: January 11, 2015: An Evening with Brother Randall L. Ridd, Highlight.

item.title: Focus Test
item.description: Focus test video mentioned in Elder Randall L. Ridds Worldwide Devotional talk.

item.title: Like A Watered Garden - Highlight 1
item.description: September 13, 2015: An Evening with Elder L. Whitney Clayton, Highlight.

item.title: Like A Watered Garden - Highlight 2
item.description: September 13, 2015: An Evening with Elder L. Whitney Clayton, Highlight.

item.title: Like A Watered Garden - Highlight 3
item.description: September 13, 2015: An Evening with Elder L. Whitney Clayton, Highlight.

item.title: 2010 Worldwide Leadership Training
item.description: General authorities teach principles from the new handbook in the November 2010 Worldwide Leadership Training.

item.title: Opening Remarks
item.description: President Monson introduces the new church handbook and encourages leaders to study and obey its teachings.

item.title: Overview of the New Handbooks
item.description: Elder Oaks explains the purpose, format, and content of the new church handbooks.

item.title: Selected Principles from the New Handbooks
item.description: Elder Cook explains the changes in councils to better focus on strengthening individuals and families in wards.

item.title: Ward Council Model
item.description: A ward council model takes place to show a proper meeting that encourages participation in planning for the needs of individuals in the ward.

item.title: Panel Discussion
item.description: General authorities and auxiliary members discuss ward councils, basic policies of the church, and use of the new handbook.

item.title: Concluding Remarks
item.description: President Packer testifies of the importance of reading, studying, and obeying the teachings found in the new handbook to strengthen the testimonies of members.

item.title: February 2011 Worldwide Leadership Training
item.description: General authorities teach and encourage leaders of the church to follow the spirit and obey prophetic counsel in their callings.

item.title: First Presidency Message
item.description: President Eyring encourages leaders to improve the use of the scriptures, the words of living prophets and the handbooks provided to help us serve.

item.title: Overview
item.description: Elder Oaks reaffirms the teachings of the handbooks by repetition and further illustrations to yeild new understanding and renew commitment.

item.title: Introduction to Handbook 2 and Related Principles
item.description: Elder Cook clarifies key principles and important matters of Handbook 2.

item.title: Discussion on Priesthood Principles
item.description: Elder Bednar, Elder Christofferson, and Elder Holland discuss priesthood principles and the work of salvation in the ward and stake.

item.title: Uniformity and Adaptation
item.description: Elder Zwick speaks on uniformity and adaptation of the handbooks in wards and stakes throughout the world.

item.title: Prepare Spiritually
item.description: A panel of general authorities and general auxiliary members discuss examples of how priesthood and auxiliaries spiritualy prepare to make a difference in their wards and stakes.

item.title: Working with the Ward Council
item.description: A panel of general authorities and general auxiliary members discuss an example of working together in ward councils.

item.title: Sisters in Councils
item.description: Elder Scott invites women of the church around the world to participate and express their opinion in ward councils.

item.title: Ministering to Youth
item.description: General authorities and auxiliary leaders discuss the example of a bishop in Sheffield, England who keeps careful watch over one of his priests and brings him back into the fold.

item.title: Concluding Remarks
item.description: Elder Nelson states that our objective is to strengthen the family and enhance the progress of each family toward the exalting ordinances and covenants of the holy temple.

item.title: February 2012 Worldwide Leadership Training
item.description: General Authorities counsel priesthood and auxiliary leaders on what we seek to do in The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints and the reason for it as well as how to accomplish the Church’s objectives.

item.title: The Doctrinal Importance of Marriage and Children
item.description: Elder Nelson discusses the doctrine that provides the reason for what we do in the Church and in our individual lives, particularly marriage, children, family, and the importance of priesthood power in the home.

item.title: Strengthening Quorums and Members
item.description: Elder Ballard leads a panel discussion on how the Church can assist in the ongoing conversion and well-being of its members, including strengthening priesthood quorums and other handbook directions.

item.title: The Gospel Answers Life’s Problems and Challenges
item.description: Elders Perry and Christofferson discuss how the restored gospel of Jesus Christ provides the answers to all of life’s challenges and how we can be more effective in making its principles and covenants bless our lives and the lives of others.

item.title: Acting on the Truths of the Gospel of Jesus Christ
item.description: President Uchtdorf counsels Church leaders on the importance of understanding inspired counsel and then acting on that counsel in order to build the kingdom of God.

item.title: Priesthood Power in the Home
item.description: President Packer discusses the importance and value of priesthood authority and leadership in the home and in the Church.

item.title: 2016 Mutual Theme: Press Forward
item.description: 2016 Mutual Theme: Press Forward

item.title: Strive
item.description: It is time to give everything we have to becoming the people God hopes we will choose to become. Join the worldwide movement to strive for the best by developing your talents, loving others, seeking education, and serving the Lord.s

item.title: Our Eternal Potential
item.description: Youth consider what distractions draw them away from following the Savior.

item.title: With All Your Heart
item.description: One young man overcomes his fears while magnifying his calling.

item.title: Our Spiritual Passport
item.description: Youth consider what they will do to add stamps to their “spiritual passports” and bless the lives of others.

item.title: Dangerous Tides
item.description: Based on the talk, Trifle Not with Sacred Things by Elder Larry S. Kacher. The choices we make in this life greatly affect our eternal life. Are your decisions planted in the Gospel of Jesus Christ?

item.title: Guided Safely Home
item.description: We live in a world full of conflict, and we will sink without a sense of direction. Jesus Christ provides that direction, and living His teachings will steer us safely home. What will you do to reach up and obtain heavenly help today?

category.title: 2015 - Embark in the Service of God
category.subtitle: Videos: 1

item.title: Embark
item.description: His love will light the way so we will stand up all together.

item.title: Christlike Attributes
item.description: The attributes of Christ depicted in scenes from His life.

item.title: Strengthened in the Lord
item.description: Youth in New York City share how seeking the Savior and following Him has helped strengthen their lives.

item.title: Come with Us
item.description: Youth from around the world share what this years theme means to them and what they are doing to “Come unto Christ.”

item.title: Come unto Christ: 2014 Theme Song
item.description: No matter what we are struggling with, there is always hope if we come unto Christ.

item.title: Stand Ye in Holy Places - Bloom Where You’re Planted
item.description: Three hundred youth in Las Vegas come together to share their testimony of Jesus Christ.

item.title: The Temple - Always in Our Sights
item.description: The path to the temple requires us to prepare, act, and keep the temple “always in our sights.”

item.title: Standards: Service - If We Forget Ourselves
item.description: A music video celebrating the good works of youth over the past year.

item.title: Strengthen Thy Brethren
item.description: As two brothers seek to strengthen their own conversion to the gospel of Jesus Christ, they find that they begin to have an effect on those around them.

item.title: Message from Brother David L. Beck
item.description: The Young Men general president is invited by a quorum president to participate in a discussion of the 2012 Mutual theme.

item.title: Message from Sister Elaine S. Dalton
item.description: The Young Women general president speaks with a group of young women about remaining virtuous on the path to the temple.

item.title: Message from Elder L. Tom Perry
item.description: Elder Perry introduces the 2012 Mutual theme, and shares how we can exemplify the theme in our daily lives.

item.title: Introduction to the Theme
item.description: Young women from around the world share how they can “Arise and shine forth” in 2012.

item.title: Virtuous Young Women
item.description: A young woman chooses modesty and virtue over participation in a special event.

item.title: Because I Have Been Given Much
item.description: With the help of a friend, a young woman in a difficult situation finds hope in the gospel of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Shining Forth in the Family
item.description: Members around the world testify that youth can have a powerful influence on their families.

item.title: 2012 Strength of Youth Media Trailer Video
item.description: Trailer video for the 2012 Strength of Youth Media: Strengthen the Rising Generation

item.title: Introduction to the 2011 Mutual Theme: Faith
item.description: Youth from around the world share their feelings about the 2011 Mutual theme, “We Believe, and what it means to be a believer.

item.title: We Believe: Theme Song
item.description: Youth from around the world perform the theme song We Believe.

item.title: The 13th Article of Faith: Standing Together
item.description: Youth in Korea, who are often the only members in their schools, find strength and support as they gather with other Latter-day Saint youth in their area.

item.title: We Believe in Doing Good to All Men: Service
item.description: When two natural disasters struck their community in the same week, Latter-day Saint youth in Guatemala City found a way to serve their neighbors.

item.title: Inviting All to Come unto Christ: Sharing the Gospel
item.description: When Junior, a young man in a small Florida branch, decided he didn’t want to be alone in his belief in Christ, he invited a friend. One friend joined, then another, and another . . .

item.title: Priesthood Men: Young Men Song
item.description: The “Priesthood Men song celebrates each young man’s part in God’s plan and encourages him to rise up as a son of God and follow His teachings.

item.title: Honest, True, Chaste, Benevolent, Virtuous: Values
item.description: Young Women express their feelings about the 2011 Mutual theme and their preparations to go to the temple.

item.title: We Have Endured Many Things: Spiritual Strength
item.description: Laura describes how she develops faith to live the gospel even though few Latter-day Saints live in her area. She receives spiritual strength from the gospel of Jesus Christ, the scriptures, and the Personal Progress program.

item.title: Seeking Whats Good: Youth Song
item.description: E. J. shares a song he co-wrote to encourage the youth of the Church to seek the good in life no matter what challenges arise.

item.title: Message from Sister Elaine S. Dalton
item.description: Sister Elaine S. Dalton expresses her love for young women around the world and counsels them to seek after good things.

item.description: “When you make a goal in Duty to God, you’re making a commitment to your Heavenly Father that you’re going to do something. It’s your duty to Him”

item.description: President Dieter F. Uchtdorf shares a humorous parable of a man who realizes he has been living far beneath his privileges.

item.title: Teaching Helps Save Lives
item.description: Russell T. Osguthorpe shares a story from his talk titled Teaching Helps Save Lives.

item.title: First Presidency Message: The Priesthood Can Strengthen Our Families in Trial
item.description: (4 of 7) President Eyring teaches that faith in God is strengthened in times of trial. The manifestation of God’s power at these times gives us hope in His promises of eternal life.

category.title: March: The Atonement of Jesus Christ
category.subtitle: Videos: 1

item.title: He Is Risen!
item.description: The empty tomb that first Easter morning was the answer to Job’s question, “If a man die, shall he live again?”

item.title: The Restoration
item.description: This video recounts how Joseph Smiths search for truth led to the First Vision and the Restoration of the gospel of Jesus Christ (JS-H 1:1-20).

item.description: President Henry B. Eyring speaks at the 2011 October General Conference.

item.title: Fulfilling Your Duty to God
item.description: “When you make a goal in Duty to God, you’re making a commitment to your Heavenly Father that you’re going to do something. It’s your duty to Him”

item.title: The Power of the Priesthood in the Family: Priesthood Blessings Available to All
item.description: (6 of 6) Elder Oaks and Bishop Caussé teach that priesthood power is the power of God to bless all of his children.

item.title: The Power of the Priesthood in the Family: Priesthood Power and Priesthood Authority
item.description: (5 of 6) Elder Oaks and Elder Golden explain the fundamental differences between priesthood power and authority. They teach how to have real power in the priesthood.

item.title: Priesthood Keys: The Restoration of Priesthood Keys
item.description: (1 of 4) Through the examples of ancient apostles, Elder Perry teaches how priesthood keys were restored to latter-day prophets.

item.title: Priesthood Keys: The Priesthood, an Opportunity to Serve
item.description: (3 of 4) Bishop Davies reads about priesthood keys from the handbook. A teachers quorum president explains how these keys have helped him to counsel, teach, and serve in his quorum.

item.title: Bringing Up Children in Light and Truth: Sustaining Each Other in the Home
item.description: (4 of 4) Church leaders emphasize the importance of husbands and wives working together as they teach their children and help them prepare to receive the ordinances of salvation.

item.title: A Wartime Miracle
item.description: Statement by President Thomas S. Monson in the priesthood session on March 31, 2012.

item.title: Ward Council Model
item.description: A ward council model takes place to show a proper meeting that encourages participation in planning for the needs of individuals in the ward.

item.title: Always Remember Him
item.description: The sacrament is an ordinance in which Church members partake of bread and water in remembrance of the sacrifice of Jesus Christ. Through this ordinance, Church members renew the covenants they made with God when they were baptized.

item.title: The Temple - Always in Our Sights
item.description: The path to the temple requires us to prepare, act, and keep the temple “always in our sights.”

item.title: First Presidency Message: Faith in the Power of the Priesthood
item.description: (1 of 7) President Eyring discusses covenants made through the power of the priesthood and teaches that the priesthood changes hearts and knits individuals together in eternal families.

item.title: Prepare to Teach
item.description: Preparing to teach requires spiritual focus throughout the week. The effort you make to study the outline, ponder your students’ needs, make a lesson plan, and live the principles you teach will bless your students.

item.title: Teaching the Gospel in the Saviors Way
item.description: The new Youth Curriculum invites leaders and teachers to follow the Saviors example as they teach the youth of the Church.

item.title: Identifying Key Points in a Conference Talk
item.description: Notice how the teacher helps these young women discover important messages in a conference talk.

item.title: Using Pictures
item.description: Watch how a picture is used to help youth discover how to make prayers more meaningful.

item.title: Teaching Each Other
item.description: Look at what this teacher does so that these youth have the opportunity to teach each other.

item.title: Personalizing Gospel Doctrines
item.description: Look for how this teacher provides an opportunity for each young man to personalize a gospel doctrine.

item.title: Determine What to Teach
item.description: In the new Youth Curriculum, leaders select lessons to teach from within an assigned gospel unit. They determine which lessons to use according to the needs of the youth they teach.

item.title: Watching a Video
item.description: Notice what this teacher does to encourage these young women to participate while watching a video.

item.title: The Power of the Priesthood in the Family: Fathers Can Use the Priesthood to Bless Their Families
item.description: (3 of 6) A quote from President Howard W. Hunter reminds us that nothing is more important than the salvation of families through the priesthood.

item.title: Blessings of the Priesthood in Every Home: The Home Is a Divine Institution
item.description: (2 of 2) A quote from President Joseph F. Smith outlines the divine roles and responsibilities of parents.

item.title: Bringing up Children in Light and Truth: Loving God’s Children
item.description: (1 of 4) A young mother shares a story that reminds us that we are all children of a loving Heavenly Father.

item.title: A Heaven-Inspired Program
item.description: We, as members of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, must stand up to the dangers which surround us and our families.

item.title: A Brand New Year: Dating
item.description: Dating can help you develop lasting friendships and eventually find an eternal companion.

item.title: Help Others Add Photos and Documents to Their Family Tree
item.description: Use your knowledge to help others with their family history. As you serve your testimony of family history will be strengthened.

item.title: Help Others Come Back to Church
item.description: Inviting others to do family history is a non-threatening way to help them feel the spirit and to give them motivation to visit the temple with the names that they find through their family history.

item.title: Help the Families You Home Teach
item.description: Sharing your family history with those you home teach is a great way to stay involved in planning and teaching.

item.title: Help New Members Take a Name to the Temple
item.description: You can help new members feel that same spirit by becoming comfortable with finding ancestors and taking their names to the temple to do ordinances for them.

item.title: Asking Follow-up Questions
item.description: Watch how this teacher asks questions that encourage the youth to share meaningful thoughts and feelings

item.title: Dare to Stand Alone
item.description: President Thomas S. Monson shares an experience he had in the Navy when he had to stand alone and reminds us that we are never alone when we stand with our Father in Heaven.

item.title: Stand Ye in Holy Places - Bloom Where You’re Planted
item.description: Three hundred youth in Las Vegas come together to share their testimony of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Guardians of Virtue
item.description: Quote given by Sister Elaine S. Dalton in the general Young Women meeting on March 26, 2011.

item.title: Christlike Attributes
item.description: The attributes of Christ depicted in scenes from His life.

item.title: First Presidency Message: Examples in Ministering
item.description: (7 of 7) President Eyring testifies that the Savior Jesus Christ is the greatest minister. Christ showed unmatched respect for His mother. He ministered powerfully among the women, children, and men who were spiritually drawn to Him.

item.title: Standards: Service - If We Forget Ourselves
item.description: A music video celebrating the good works of youth over the past year.

item.title: Inviting All to Come unto Christ: Sharing the Gospel
item.description: When Junior, a young man in a small Florida branch, decided he didn’t want to be alone in his belief in Christ, he invited a friend. One friend joined, then another, and another . . .

category.title: December: Building the Kingdom of God in the Latter Days
category.subtitle: Videos: 4

item.title: Bringing Up Children in Light and Truth: A House of Order, a House of God
item.description: (3 of 4) A discussion with the auxiliary presidents reminds us of our sacred responsibility to strive to make our homes like temples.

item.title: Missionary Open House
item.description: Two sisters accept a challenge from their Stake President to have missionaries and friends in their home more often. They created a monthly event called Cake and Ice Cream to gather friends and listen to a spiritual thought from missionaries.

item.description: Inviting others to do family history is a non-threatening way to help them feel the spirit and to give them motivation to visit the temple with the names that they find through their family history.

item.description: Notice how this teacher encourages the young men to be actively involved in using visual aids.

item.description: Watch how these youth are invited to personalize what they have learned from the scriptures.

item.description: Watch how the youth find and share insights from the scriptures that help them answer the question.

item.description: Watch how this teacher responds to the question of a young man.

item.description: Notice how these young women are encouraged to search the scriptures for words that are meaningful to them.

item.description: Watch how this teacher encourages the young men to search the scriptures.

item.description: Look for how this teacher helps these young women set a personal goal to act on what they are learning.

item.description: Watch how this teacher invites the youth to act on their goals.

item.title: Reviewing What They Learned
item.description: Watch how the teacher reviews with the youth what they learned about the importance of the scriptures.

item.description: Notice what this teacher does to encourage these young women to participate while watching a video.

item.title: Aaronic Priesthood Quorum Presidency Meeting
item.description: A demonstration of an Aaronic Priesthood Quorum Presidency Meeting

item.title: Aaronic Priesthood Quorum Meeting
item.description: an example of an Aaronic Priesthood Quorum Meeting

item.title: Prepare to Teach
item.description: Preparing to teach requires spiritual focus throughout the week. The effort you make to study the outline, ponder your students’ needs, make a lesson plan, and live the principles you teach will bless your students.

item.title: Teaching the Gospel in the Saviors Way
item.description: The new Youth Curriculum invites leaders and teachers to follow the Saviors example as they teach the youth of the Church.

item.title: Determine What to Teach
item.description: In the new Youth Curriculum, leaders select lessons to teach from within an assigned gospel unit. They determine which lessons to use according to the needs of the youth they teach.

item.title: We Teach
item.description: We teach the gospel wherever we can: at home, in sacrament meeting, in Primary, with our friends at school, and in our classes and quorum meetings. When we share our testimonies, the Holy Ghost testifies to us that what were saying is true.

item.title: Face to Face for YSA: with Elder Jeffrey R. Holland, Sister Carole M. Stephens, and Elder Donald L. Hallstrom
item.description: In this first Face to Face for Young Single Adults, Elder Jeffrey R. Holland, Sister Carole M. Stephens and Elder Donald L. Hallstrom of the Seventy share their inspired thoughts and testimonies.

item.title: Face to Face with Elder Rasband, Sister Oscarson and Brother Owens
item.description: This worldwide broadcast that featured a discussion with Elder Ronald A. Rasband of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles; Sister Bonnie L. Oscarson, general Young Women president; and Brother Stephen W. Owen, general Young Men president.

item.title: Face to Face with the Piano Guys
item.description: In this recording of the Face to Face event, the group’s members; Jon Schmidt, Steven Sharp Nelson, Paul Anderson and Al van der Beek answer questions from youth all around the world.

item.title: Elder and Sister Bednar- Introduction Prayer
item.description: A young woman offers the introductory prayer for the Face to Face with Elder and Sister Bednar.

item.title: Stay In The Boat
item.description: Elder M. Russell Ballard teaches the importance of staying in the ship of Zion.

item.title: Painted into a Corner
item.description: A young man learns the importance of repentance and how agency is an essential part of life.

item.title: Service Through Song
item.description: Service is an opportunity to share love in inspired ways. This short video shows how a group of youth provide love to a group of elderly residents by singing hymns every Sunday night.

item.title: Guided Safely Home
item.description: We live in a world full of conflict, and we will sink without a sense of direction. Jesus Christ provides that direction, and living His teachings will steer us safely home. What will you do to reach up and obtain heavenly help today?

item.title: Dangerous Tides
item.description: Based on the talk, Trifle Not with Sacred Things by Elder Larry S. Kacher. The choices we make in this life greatly affect our eternal life. Are your decisions planted in the Gospel of Jesus Christ?

item.title: Strive
item.description: It is time to give everything we have to becoming the people God hopes we will choose to become. Join the worldwide movement to strive for the best by developing your talents, loving others, seeking education, and serving the Lord.s

item.title: Good To Be Alive
item.description: Regan Rindlisbacher performs her song about having a positive outlook on life, looking for the beauty in the world, and cherishing relationships with those we love.

item.title: This Life
item.description: What are we doing with this life? Are we spending it on things that make us better, brighter, and more able to help our friends do the same? Do we treasure every moment?

item.title: Fragile
item.description: “Remember what you are worth.” That is the simple yet powerful message of the 2015 mutual theme song, “Fragile.” We must be kind to others, and when we ourselves are hurt we must turn to Jesus Christ, who knows and loves us always.

item.title: When Ye Are in the Service-YM
item.description: A young man in California experiences joy as he takes on the challenge to see how much service he can provide to those around him in 3 days.

item.title: When Ye Are in the Service-YW
item.description: Young Women in Japan experience joy as they take on the challenge to see how much service they can provide to those around them in 3 days.

item.title: Our Eternal Potential
item.description: Youth consider what distractions draw them away from following the Savior.

item.title: Our Spiritual Passport
item.description: Youth consider what they will do to add stamps to their “spiritual passports” and bless the lives of others.

item.title: Sharing Your Light
item.description: A young woman from the Philippines shares her faith and hope in knowing that by setting a good example, those around her can return to following the Savior.

item.title: Texting Truth
item.description: A group of young men share how they use text-messaging to learn scriptures and uplift each other. Elder Scott describes ways we can use text messaging, phones, and more to draw closer to Christ, strengthen others, and increase our gospel knowledge.

item.title: With All Your Heart
item.description: One young man overcomes his fears while magnifying his calling.

item.title: Want to Increase your Faith?
item.description: Struggling with faith? Want to gain a testimony? What might you need to do...Your faith will grow, not by chance, but by choice.- Neil L. Andersen

item.title: Instructions Included
item.description: How does keeping the commandments help us?

item.title: Help Others Add Photos and Documents to Their Family Tree
item.description: Use your knowledge to help others with their family history. As you serve your testimony of family history will be strengthened.

item.title: Help Others Find Records by Indexing
item.description: We are here to participate in the work of salvation in inviting all of these people to come unto Christ and receive the saving ordinances of the gospel.

item.title: Help Others Come Back to Church
item.description: Inviting others to do family history is a non-threatening way to help them feel the spirit and to give them motivation to visit the temple with the names that they find through their family history.

item.title: Help New Members Take a Name to the Temple
item.description: You can help new members feel that same spirit by becoming comfortable with finding ancestors and taking their names to the temple to do ordinances for them.

item.title: Help the Families You Home Teach
item.description: Sharing your family history with those you home teach is a great way to stay involved in planning and teaching.

item.title: FamilySearch Records Preservation: Niue Island
item.description: FamilySearch helped prevent the loss of public land, marriage, and other historical records by archiving these records before a major hurricane struck Niue Island.
